verses.verse: (Plea for Help in Time of National Humiliation) A Maskil of Asaph. (Deut 29.20; Ps 44.9, 23) O God, why do you cast us off forever? Why does your anger smoke against the sheep of your pasture?
(Deut 32.6; Ps 77.15) Remember your congregation, which you acquired long ago, which you redeemed to be the tribe of your heritage. Remember Mount Zion, where you came to dwell.
(Ps 79.1; Isa 61.4) Direct your steps to the perpetual ruins; the enemy has destroyed everything in the sanctuary.
(Num 2.2; Lam 2.7) Your foes have roared within your holy place; they set up their emblems there.
(Jer 46.22) At the upper entrance they hacked the wooden trellis with axes. (Cn Compare Gk Syr: Meaning of Heb uncertain)
And then, with hatchets and hammers, they smashed all its carved work.
(2 Kings 25.9) They set your sanctuary on fire; they desecrated the dwelling place of your name, bringing it to the ground.
(Ps 83.4) They said to themselves, “We will utterly subdue them”; they burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
(1 Sam 3.1; Ps 78.43) We do not see our emblems; there is no longer any prophet, and there is no one among us who knows how long.
(Lev 24.16) How long, O God, is the foe to scoff? Is the enemy to revile your name forever?
(Ps 59.13) Why do you hold back your hand; why do you keep your hand in (Cn: Heb do you consume your right hand from) your bosom?
(Ps 44.4) Yet God my King is from of old, working salvation in the earth.
(Isa 51.9) You divided the sea by your might; you broke the heads of the dragons in the waters.
You crushed the heads of Leviathan; you gave him as food (Heb food for the people) for the creatures of the wilderness.
(Ex 17.5, 6; Num 20.11; Josh 3.13) You cut openings for springs and torrents; you dried up ever-flowing streams.
(Ps 104.19) Yours is the day, yours also the night; you established the luminaries (Or moon; Heb light) and the sun.
(Gen 8.22) You have fixed all the bounds of the earth; you made summer and winter.
(v 10|PSA 74:10; Ps 39.8) Remember this, O LORD, how the enemy scoffs, and an impious people reviles your name.
(Ps 9.18; Song 2.14) Do not deliver the soul of your dove to the wild animals; do not forget the life of your poor forever.
(Gen 17.7; Ps 88.6; 106.45) Have regard for your (Gk Syr: Heb the) covenant, for the dark places of the land are full of the haunts of violence.
(Ps 35.10; 103.6) Do not let the downtrodden be put to shame; let the poor and needy praise your name.
(v 18|PSA 74:18; Ps 43.1) Rise up, O God, plead your cause; remember how the impious scoff at you all day long.
(v 10|PSA 74:10; Ps 65.7) Do not forget the clamor of your foes, the uproar of your adversaries that goes up continually.
